item.title: Fly tipping, 1st October
item.description:
Three areas of this stretch of road need to have fly tipped items removed. These piles continue to get bigger and are a health hazard. Council needs to take action.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Sandy Hill Road, London

item.title: Bins in childrens play area on Adams Garden Estate, 1st October
item.description:
I would just like to make you aware that Southwark Council are failing to make the scheduled collections in the Adams Gardens Estate children’s play area and the bins have not attended the station for over 3 months I would also like to add that this is now starting to become a serious pest control issue and there has been numerous reports of mice and rats on the estate in the bin areas due to the large amount of rubbish which has not been emptied

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rupack Street, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin's obstruction for public foot path unsafe for disabled people wheelchair access restricted., 1st October
item.description:

item.title: Missing light on public footpath and staircase, 1st October
item.description:
We moved to Hill Crescent earlier in the year and are dependent on the trains from Bexley station for our commutes to and from work. There are two footpaths leading to Hill Crescent but none of them are lid at all. This report in particular, is addressing the footpath and staircase between Hill Crescent and Vicarage Road. The reduced daylight in the autumn and winter months combined with the steepness of the path make it rather unsafe to walk on. Discussing potential reasons for the absence of lighting with other residents on Hill Crescent it was mentioned that some residents may have been bothered by light coming into their property or the presence of bats. The presence of high fences between the path and properties should avoid any light pollution by installing lower lights. The issue of bats was addressed in other councils without putting the public at risk of falling, e.g.: https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-hereford-worcester-49534621.amp Thank you for looking into this.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hill Crescent, Coldblow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing Street Lighting on Public Path, 1st October
item.description:
We moved to Hill Crescent earlier in the year and are dependent on the trains from Bexley station for our commutes to and from work. There are two footpaths leading to Hill Crescent but none of them are lid at all. This report in particular, is addressing the footpath between Hill Crescent, alongside Becketts Close and the main path leading to St. Mary’s Church Hall. The reduced daylight in the autumn and winter months combined with the unevenness and steepness of the path make it rather unsafe to walk on. My husband leaves the house at 6am. The photoes attached were taken around that time on Monday, 29 September, and show how it is pitch black on the path until the light from private properties come on. Discussing potential reasons for the absence of lighting with other residents on Hill Crescent it was mentioned that some residents may have been bothered by light coming into their property or the presence of bats. The presence of high fences between the path and properties should avoid any light pollution by installing lower lights. The issue of bats was addressed in other councils without putting the public at risk of falling, e.g.: https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-hereford-worcester-49534621.amp We would appreciate it if you could review and address the issue. Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Becketts Close, Coldblow, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light in park or open space

item.title: Rubbish bins, 1st October
item.description:
People from other areas keeps coming and throwing their rubbish near the bins and leaves a mess. Letters and other rubbish keeps blowing around the estate onto people's door steps and this it is there for days. Cars and vans come in and throw all their unwanted rubbish and then leaves.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dunbar Street, West Norwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet
